summary: This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July to August 2019, detailing physical examinations, vital signs, diagnoses, medications, and treatment plans. It includes records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York and documents his health status and medical care leading up to his transfer in August 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of all medical records, detailing his health status, examinations, diagnoses, and treatments while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: A medical provider (Mid-Level Provider) who conducted physical examinations, recorded vitals, and entered medical orders for Jeffrey Epstein on multiple dates, including July 9, 2019.

persons.name: Robert Beaudown
persons.context: A physician (MD) who cosigned medical documentation and entered medication orders for regular insulin for Jeffrey Epstein on July 31, 2019.

persons.name: PA-C
persons.context: A physician assistant who administered a PPD test and noted 'No Known Allergies' for Jeffrey Epstein on July 6, 2019.

connections.description: MLP was a primary medical provider conducting examinations and entering orders for inmate Epstein.
Dr. Beaudown entered and cosigned medication orders (insulin) for Epstein.
Multiple physicians were involved in cosigning documents and managing Epstein's medical care.
Registered nurses monitored vitals, provided education, and prepared transfer documents for Epstein.
A physician assistant administered a tuberculosis test and recorded allergy information for Epstein.

events.title: Comprehensive Physical Examination
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein underwent a detailed physical examination at the MCC, which noted normal findings in multiple systems but a history of constipation, for which medication (Bisacodyl) was prescribed.

events.title: PPD Tuberculosis Test Reading
events.description: A previously administered PPD skin test was read, showing 0mm induration (negative result).

events.title: Medical Encounter Cosign
events.description: A physician (MD) cosigned the medical encounter documentation from July 9, 2019.

events.title: Pain Management Intervention
events.description: Epstein received a Medrol Dose Pack for shooting back pain, documented in pain management records.

events.title: CPAP Machine Issued
events.description: A CPAP machine was issued to Epstein for his diagnosed sleep apnea.

events.title: Insulin Order Initiated
events.description: Dr. Robert Beaudown ordered regular insulin to be administered subcutaneously per a sliding scale for 7 days, indicating management of blood glucose levels.

events.title: Medical Transfer Preparation
events.description: A comprehensive medical transfer summary was generated, listing Epstein's health problems, medications, and pending appointments in preparation for a transfer.

locations: NEW YORK MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center), 150 PARK ROW, NEW YORK, New York 10007
NYM (Bureau of Prisons facility designation, likely MCC New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's BOP medical records from July-August 2019 document numerous chronic health conditions including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, hypertension, constipation, low back pain, neuralgia, prediabetes, and an elevated BMI.
Epstein was prescribed regular insulin via sliding scale starting July 31, 2019, indicating active management of blood glucose levels, alongside other medications like Vascepa and stool softeners.
A CPAP machine was issued on July 30, 2019, for diagnosed sleep apnea.
The records note 'R/O self inflicted injuries' (Rule Out self-inflicted injuries) under an 'Injury, unspecified' diagnosis entered on July 23, 2019.
A medical transfer document was prepared on August 10, 2019, summarizing his health status for transfer, listing allergies (fish) and a cell restriction (lower bunk).
